original_title: Here We Are: Voices of Black Women Who Live with HIV
overview: Davina “Dee” Conner was diagnosed with HIV in 1997. For 18 years she knew no one else who lived with HIV. As she emerged from isolation and internalized stigma, Davina sought to understand the journeys of other Black women living with HIV. Here they are. Listen to their voices.
title: Here We Are: Voices of Black Women Who Live with HIV
